TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 701
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to Jared E. Groce, 10-18-1823

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 701

div1.p: Austin to Jared E. Groce. Land sales.

Due Jared E. Groce or bearer three Hundred and twenty six dollars any forty nine cents to be paid in land at one Bit pr. acre and I have agreed Jared E. Groce shall have seven leagues of land in my colony and he has settled for five leags all to the surveying and other expences and the above sum of three hundred and twenty six dollars and forty nine cents is part of the payment of the other two leages Oct. 18th 1823
[Signed by Austin, but signature torn off when note was canceled]
